title: Kneepkens is emeritus professor of Medieval Latin language and literature at the University of Groningen. He specializes in history of medieval semantics and grammar. Recent publications include “The New Italian Learning and the Modern Devotion: Valla, Synthen, Erasmus, and Elegant Latin

note: and The Philosophy of Francisco Suarez (Oxford: 2012). He is also the editor-in-chief of the Encyclopedia of Medieval Philosophy (Springer, 2011).
title: Henrik Lagerlund received his PhD from Uppsala University in 1999 and is currently associate professor and chair of the Department of Philosophy at the University of Western Ontario. He has published extensively on medieval philosophy, including the monograph Modal Syllogistics in the Middle Ages
Among his edited books are Rethinking the History of Skepticism

title: Alfonso Maierù† was emeritus professor in the Faculty of Letters at the University of Rome “La Sapienza.” He was a pioneer in the field of medieval semantics and logic. His major publications include University Training in Medieval Europe

title: Paul Thom is honorary professor of philosophy at the University of Sydney. He specializes in history of logic and philosophy of the performing arts
